ab.note: The initial kappa of this word is written as a small capital.
Folios 62 and 69 have been swapped in the manuscript (so this folio is actually found around the end of Matthew), but their original numbering is correct.
The initial kappa of this word is written as a small capital.
The scribe may have dripped ink from one point of the tau to another, creating the appearance of an στ ligature at the beginning of this word.

A drop-cap κ was probably intended here, but was not written.

This phrase was deliberately set apart from the text by the first hand, suggesting that it may have been considered a scholion to offer interpretation to the text. The only other occurrence of this reading to the transcriber's knowledge is in GA 461, where it appears to have been erased almost beyond recognition.
This correction is likely intended to be placed one line down, after τον λογον.
